section.title: ver14.SharedClasses.Game.Moves.Direction Enum Reference

listitem.para: static Direction getRelative (Location loc1, Location loc2)
static final List< Direction > ALL_USED_DIRECTIONS = Arrays.stream(values()).filter(d -> d != U_U && d != D_D).collect(Collectors.toList())

section.title: Detailed Description
section.para:
Direction - represents a moving direction on a board. sort of like a vector. has an offset that is added to a certain location or bitboard, in order to achieve movement in that direction. the general direction map looks like this:
-9
-8
-7
-1
loc
1
7
8
9

section.title: opposite()
section.para: the Opposite direction to this one.

section.title: perspective()
section.para: gets the correct perspective for the provided player color.this is necessary because for example: a white pawn push(U) is the exact opposite of a black pawn push (D). so the perspective needs to be in relation to the moving color.
